intro: Oberonia djongkongensis, commonly known as the Djongkong orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, fragrant flowers. The plant typically produces small, greenish-yellow blooms with intricate patterns, often found in shaded, humid forest environments. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to conserve moisture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oberonia djongkongensis is considered a threatened species.
